So why is this facility in Mississippi? Thank Senator John Stennis - and politicians everywhere in the world. The USA has a word for it: porkbarrelling. SpaceX is not immune as the tax regimes of different states greatly influence where things happen...at taxpayer expense. But we encourage and celebrate when 'our' state 'wins' (or province, in my case).

With a third role of continuing the robotic space exploration.

Something is a bit off when you do not declare victory in this case, where the engine worked less than the full test series that was programmed, but declared victory when the Falcon test crashed and burned. A more balanced perspective would be to call both tests "partial successes", and have a flexible test schedule that gives the accumulation of experience more importance than to the number of tests before entering production. A big error among many with the Shuttle program was to rush the test program, and go ahead with the program when the infamous tile problems were never, ever corrected.

Tim:  SLS uses 4 RL-25 engines @418,000 FT/LBs thrust each (SL),  AND the Saturn 5 used 5  F-1 engines @ 1,522,000  FT/LBs thrust each (SL),   All 4 RS25 engines combined produce just about what ONE F-1 engine produces alone. Then how can they claim the SLS is the most powerful rocket ever made?  Saturn = 7,610,000 Ft/Lbs  thrust against SLS Rocket = 1,672,000 Ft/Lbs thrust      Plus 2-SRBs  @ 2,800,000 ea = 7,272,000

If you don't have two hours, start watching at 1:45:00. I have one disagreement: at 1:47:43 he says "that is no pollution that is just water vapour." In theory that's true, but in this case when the rocket is sitting directly over the ground, it would inevitably heat up and ablate some ground material and so there would be a lot of other atoms mixed in with that water vapour, including atoms that would be considered pollutants. And I wouldn't be surprised if the engines weren't 100.0000000000000000% efficient which means a few stray molecules of O2 and H2 might be in that steam.
You've heard of rocket engines having an oxygen-rich, a fuel-rich or an engine-rich exhaust? This one has a tax-rich exhaust!

"green" usually means "your first time", like when someone new comes onto a boat to work, he's "green". A "green run" means a "virgin run", or the first time a rocket engine & systems are lit in their configuration's life cycle.
